verses.verse: Then answered<WH6030> Eliphaz<WH464> the Temanite,<WH8489> and said,<WH559>
Should a wise<WH2450> man utter<WH6030> vain<WH7307> knowledge,<WH1847> and fill<WH4390> his belly<WH990> with the east<WH6921> wind?<WH7307>
Should he reason<WH3198> with unprofitable<WH5532> talk?<WH1697> or with speeches<WH4405> with which he can do<WH5953> no<WH3808> good?<WH3276>
Yes,<WH637> you cast<WH6565> off fear,<WH3374> and restrain<WH1639> prayer<WH7878> before<WH6440> God.<WH410>
For your mouth<WH6310> utters<WH502> your iniquity,<WH5771> and you choose<WH977> the tongue<WH3956> of the crafty.<WH6175>
Your own mouth<WH6310> comdemns<WH7561> you, and not I: yes, your own lips<WH8193> testify<WH6030> against you.
Are you the first<WH7223> man<WH120> that was born?<WH3205> or were you made<WH2342> before<WH6440> the hills?<WH1389>
Have you heard<WH8085> the secret<WH5475> of God?<WH433> and do you restrain<WH1639> wisdom<WH2451> to yourself?<WH413>
What<WH4100> know<WH3045> you, that we know<WH3045> not? what understand<WH995> you, which<WH1931> is not in us?
With us are both<WH1571> the gray headed<WH7867> and very<WH3453> aged<WH3453> men, much<WH3524> elder<WH1419> than your father.<WH1>
Are the consolations<WH8575> of God<WH410> small<WH4592> with you? is there any secret<WH328> thing<WH1697> with you?
Why<WH4100> does your heart<WH3820> carry<WH3947> you away? and what<WH4100> do your eyes<WH5869> wink<WH7335> at,
That you turn<WH7725> your spirit<WH7307> against<WH413> God,<WH410> and let such words<WH4405> go<WH3318> out of your mouth?<WH6310>
What<WH4100> is man,<WH582> that he should be clean?<WH2135> and he which is born<WH3205> of a woman,<WH802> that he should be righteous?<WH6663>
Behold,<WH2005> he puts no<WH3808> trust<WH539> in his saints;<WH6918> yes, the heavens<WH8064> are not clean<WH2141> in his sight.<WH5869>
How<WH637> much more abominable<WH8581> and filthy<WH444> is man,<WH376> which drinks<WH8354> iniquity<WH5766> like water?<WH4325>
I will show<WH2331> you, hear<WH8085> me; and that which I have seen<WH2372> I will declare;<WH5608>
Which<WH834> wise<WH2450> men have told<WH5046> from their fathers,<WH1> and have not hid<WH3582> it:
To whom<WH1992> alone<WH905> the earth<WH776> was given,<WH5414> and no<WH3808> stranger<WH2114> passed<WH5674> among<WH8432> them.
The wicked<WH7563> man travails<WH2342> with pain all<WH3605> his days,<WH3117> and the number<WH4557> of years<WH8141> is hidden<WH6845> to the oppressor.<WH6184>
A dreadful<WH6343> sound<WH6963> is in his ears:<WH241> in prosperity<WH7965> the destroyer<WH7703> shall come<WH935> on him.
He believes<WH539> not that he shall return<WH7725> out of darkness,<WH2822> and he is waited<WH6822> for of the sword.<WH2719>
He wanders<WH5074> abroad<WH5074> for bread,<WH3899> saying, Where<WH346> is it? he knows<WH3045> that the day<WH3117> of darkness<WH2822> is ready<WH3559> at his hand.<WH3027>
Trouble<WH6862> and anguish<WH4691> shall make him afraid;<WH1204> they shall prevail<WH8630> against him, as a king<WH4428> ready<WH6264> to the battle.<WH3593>
For he stretches<WH5186> out his hand<WH3027> against<WH413> God,<WH410> and strengthens<WH1396> himself against<WH413> the Almighty.<WH7706>
He runs<WH7323> on him, even on his neck,<WH6677> on the thick<WH5672> bosses<WH1354> of his bucklers:<WH4043>
Because<WH3588> he covers<WH3680> his face<WH6440> with his fatness,<WH2459> and makes<WH6213> bulges<WH6371> of fat<WH6371> on his flanks.<WH3689>
And he dwells<WH7931> in desolate<WH3582> cities,<WH5892> and in houses<WH1004> which no<WH3808> man inhabits,<WH3427> which<WH834> are ready<WH6257> to become heaps.<WH1530>
He shall not be rich,<WH6238> neither<WH3808> shall his substance<WH2428> continue,<WH6965> neither<WH3808> shall he prolong<WH5186> the perfection<WH4512> thereof on the earth.<WH776>
He shall not depart<WH5493> out of darkness;<WH2822> the flame<WH7957> shall dry<WH3001> up his branches,<WH3127> and by the breath<WH7307> of his mouth<WH6310> shall he go<WH5493> away.
Let not him that is deceived<WH8582> trust<WH539> in vanity:<WH7723> for vanity<WH7723> shall be his recompense.<WH8545>
It shall be accomplished<WH4390> before<WH3808> his time,<WH3117> and his branch<WH3712> shall not be green.<WH7488>
He shall shake<WH2554> off his unripe<WH1154> grape<WH1154> as the vine,<WH1612> and shall cast<WH7993> off his flower<WH5328> as the olive.<WH2132>
For the congregation<WH5712> of hypocrites<WH2611> shall be desolate,<WH1565> and fire<WH784> shall consume<WH398> the tabernacles<WH168> of bribery.<WH7810>
They conceive<WH2029> mischief,<WH5999> and bring<WH3205> forth<WH3205> vanity,<WH205> and their belly<WH990> prepares<WH3559> deceit.<WH4820>
